name: Minutes to Manhattan & Jersey Shore
description:
Walking to distance to Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island with New York City Skyline.
Jersey City Medical Center is less than a mile away from this home.
neighborhood_overview: Such close proximity to NYC, 7 minutes on the Path  Train to World Trade Center, 25 Mins to Empire State Building in NYC.
host_about: Thank you for taking the time to learn a bit about me. My family and I have been proud residents of Jersey City, New Jersey for over a decade, and we truly believe it's a remarkable place to call home. Along with my love for travel, I've had the opportunity to explore various parts of Europe, Asia, and Africa. Among all the wonderful destinations, Tahiti holds a special place in my heart—it felt like paradise on Earth.

name: Spacious Studio minutes away from NYC
description: Spacious Studio loft apartment on the ground floor. Can accommodate 4 people. Located in Jersey City, only a 7-minutes walk to Journal Square Path Train subway station and 15 to 20 minutes train ride to NYC. 15 minutes drive to Holland Tunnel. 20 minutes drive to Newark airport. Laundry in the building.
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is seconds from "Little India", which offers low-budget to formal Indian dining, in addition to Filipino, Latin American, and Egyptian cuisine, reflecting the city's wide ethnic population. Downtown Jersey City is also minutes away and offers a big variety of Bars and Restaurants.

Jersey City is just across the Hudson river, and it's closer and better connected to the heart of Manhattan than some boroughs and locations in New York City. It is literally 10 minutes away from Downtown Manhattan by subway (path train) and 15mn away from Greenwich Village and midtown. The Path Train runs all day and all night on a schedule.
host_about:
I am an artist working with movement and stuff. Originally from Italy. 
I travel often with art projects and use airbnb and I equally allow other people to use my house. My place is simple nothing luxurious but with good energy if you are into that, and I try to keep the price affordable.

name: Lovely Apartment - Easy access to NYC
description: Our guests tell us that they love coming back to the apartment - that it feels like home. We want our guests to know that even though you can see the Empire State Building from the apartment, it still takes about 45 minutes to get into Manhattan.
neighborhood_overview: Our area of Jersey City Heights is quiet and safe and yet just a short bus or train ride to the middle of Manhattan. Guests tell us they enjoy coming back to the quiet of our apartment after a busy day in NYC.
host_about: My husband Harry and I have lived in this area all of our lives except for two years in London. We are happy to share our insights about where to go in the NYC area.  Our grown children are gone so we decided to convert our top floor into this lovely vacation rental.  It is a completely separate apartment from our own.  We look forward to having visitors stay in this apartment. We speak some Spanish.

name: Nice Apt -10 minutes to Manhattan
description:
Large apartment in Downtown Jersey City, steps from the Grove street Path station, less than 10 minutes away from Downtown Manhattan (World Trade Center.)

STR22-116
neighborhood_overview:
Mercer Street is in the heart of Historic Downtown/Van Vorst areas of Jersey City anchored by the Grove Street PATH station. When not exploring Manhattan, there is much to do in Jersey City. These include:
* walking along the Hudson River Waterfront for great views of Manhattan or venturing over to Hoboken for the great bar scene
* checking out the great restaurants in the area
* visiting massive Liberty State Park which has ferry service to Ellis Island and the Statue of Liberty
* taking the kids to the Liberty Science Center
* attending the Farmers' Market or the live music performances at Grove Square: http://www.jcdowntown.org/
* shopping at the Newport Center Mall or the local boutiques scattered on Grove Street or finding a bargain at the flea market on Saturday's at Van Vorst Park
host_about: We love to travel and meet new people. Bob is originally from Connecticut and Francois from France, we've been living in NY/NJ for twenty years. We also like art, music and movies. And we both speak French and English! Due to our busy schedule, one of us will be your host in the listing of your choosing. Welcome to Jersey City and New York!

name: 2B/2Ba Maximalist Apt Close 2NYC
description: Welcome to my dreamland! Inside you will find a mixture of vintage finds with a focus on pop culture + 80s/90s aesthetic , along with a modern maximalist flair. Enjoy my eclectic album collection and original Nintendo Entertainment System. You will have full access to whatever treats are in the fridge, a sometimes stocked pantry and bar cart. Natural light beams into this apartment all day long! We are a pet friendly home and include a large crate, food container and toys for your furry friend.
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights is enchanting newcomers for its charm, strong sense of community and thriving local business scene.

The Heights overlooks Hoboken from the Palisades, and because Hoboken is a historic district with height restrictions there are no high rises affording the Heights protected NYC views. Central Avenue and Palisade Avenue boast immaculate Manhattan skyline and Hudson River vistas.

Jersey City Heights retains the feeling of a small town and is very walkable. I would describe the Heights as youthful, energetic and extremely diverse.
host_about:
Texas born and raised. Living in Jersey City since 2012. Salon owner and lover of all things pink, musicals, vintage and cute dogs. I enjoy discovering local antique stores and small businesses. 
"A day without laughter is a day wasted" Charlie Chaplin

name: Dr Norton House@Lincoln Park JC,NJ
description: Private, large apt in Victorian House in Historic Lincoln Park section of Jersey City. 1 mile to JSQ PATH train to NYC/Hoboken. Bus on corner to NYC! Hardwd flrs, 12 foot ceilings, new kitchen, 1.5 baths, 2 BR,  sofa in bedroom and living room (no sleeper sofa), TV, WiFi, laundry. Parking MAY be available for a fee in shared driveway and must be requested at time of booking.
neighborhood_overview:
It is one mile from the Journal Square transportation center (JSQ on the PATH line). From JSQ, you can take the PATH to Newark and catch the NJ Transit trains. You can also go to Hoboken, World Trade Center or take the 33rd Street line to Greenwich Village or uptown. It takes less than one hour to get to 33rd St via PATH. There is a bus stop right on the corner about 100 feet away. From there, you can get the bus to JSQ or directly into Port Authority in NYC, which puts you right near Times Square and the theater district. The bus to Port Authority usually takes 45-60 minutes. We are one block from Lincoln Park, which offers great walks and opportunities to work out, including jogging paths and a track.
We are 5 blocks from St. Peter's University, 1.5 miles to NJCU and a mile from Hudson County Community College.
We are also very close to Liberty State Park, which is one of the most visited state parks in the country! You can get a ferry to the Statue of Liberty or Ellis Is
host_about: I am a lifelong resident of Jersey City, NJ. I work in Hoboken, NJ. I also have spent much of my life at the Jersey Shore. I travel a fair amount and spend a lot of time in New England, specifically Maine and Martha's Vineyard. I am a hairdresser and musician. Piano is my main instrument. I am also a licensed social worker in NJ!  If you are coming to the NJ/NY area, I hope you consider staying here at the beautiful apartment in the Dr. Norton House! I can help you find all sorts of great things to do and places to eat and visit. Contact me for any further questions or info!

name: Cute private apt Jersey City (NYC area no smoking)
description: Enjoy a beautiful, private, non-smoking, 1bd apt in a two-family home blocks from Liberty State Park in Jersey City, close to ferry to NYC Manhattan and light rail which connects to PATH train. Full kitchen w/ dishwasher, tub/shower, desk for working from home, private outdoor area.  Queen-size bed in bedroom & a regular couch in living room. Whether you come to see New York on a budget in comfort, or stay to get the feel of Jersey City living, this is a wonderful, welcoming place.
neighborhood_overview: We are just blocks away from Liberty State Park where you can get a great view of the Statue of Liberty and the Manhattan skyline. Our neighborhood (Lafayette) was home to Lenape and then one of the oldest Dutch settlements in the area. We are now an urban area close to light rail and ferry. The PATH train is a 20 minute walk or take the light rail to connect.
host_about: We are a family who loves living in Jersey City. We are involved in community groups working to make this a wonderful place to live, work and play.  We live on a quiet, family-friendly street and enjoy using Liberty State Park and all of the other amenities our area offers. We also love to travel, and our favorite places to visit so far are the west coast of Ireland, Prague, San Francisco and the Yucatan peninsula. We like to be active when traveling- to learn the history of a place. When hosting we love for our guests to learn the same. We will give you as much or as little advice/direction as you want and most of all we want you to enjoy this place as much as we do.

name: Lrg Garden Studio w/Yard Min 30 Night Corp Rental
description: This is a large 2-room fully furnished studio apartment (650 sqft) in the garden level of a historic row house (circa 1843) in a historic district of Jersey City for a sublet minimum of 30 days and a maximum of 95 days. Private entrance from street and yard. Location Best! The bedding is very comfortable with a quality queen mattress and bedding.  Extremely clean and comfortable.
neighborhood_overview: The Paulus Hook Historic District of Jersey City is in very close proximity to downtown and midtown New York City (Manhattan).  You can take the ferry or path trains to various locations.
host_about:
I spent 20 years on Wall Street as a Risk Manager.  I live here with my family (wife and 7 year old son and 8 year old daughter).  This row house was built in 1843.  I am a CPA and I have an MBA in finance.  I attended NYU and Fordham University.  My family and I live in the top three floors and are making available the garden level.  The garden level is a separate apartment and this building is a legal two family.  The garden level was recently restored and most everything in it is new except for a few items.  The yard is quiet and the apartment has a private entrance from both the street and yard.  

My wife and I typically travel to the Caribbean islands and prefer quiet locations such as Anguilla, St John's, Tortola, Barbuda, the Grenadine Islands or the Outer Islands of the Bahamas.  Because of our children we have not traveled to Europe or other far places in recent years.  We also travel to Maine, Vermont and Cape Code during the summer months.

name: Historic Downtown Jersey City (Legal)
description: Less than 15 minutes from Manhattan by PATH- Vibrant downtown Jersey City offers diverse restaurants, authentic French and Italian bakeries, quaint parks, farmer's markets and a night time Hudson River view of the sparkling New York City skyline. We are certified as a short term rental.
neighborhood_overview: Ideal location for a New York visit.  Plenty of hip spots here in Jersey City - but let's face it - New York is right next door!
host_about: Jennifer and Roland fell in love in Washington DC, and now live in their dream home in downtown Jersey City.  Jennifer works in Midtown Manhattan and Roland works in his home-office.  They have three 20 somethings - real New Yorkers, smart, sassy and worldly.  And they travel often to see their family in California, Israel, France and Germany.  Come and stay with us!

name: Big modern room 5 min walk to Path/WIFI/TV/Desk
description:
The large private room provides a comfortable and well-equipped space for travelers seeking convenience and accessibility.

With a queen bed, work desk, huge closet, and the added convenience of a washer and dryer, it offers a pleasant and hassle-free stay. Plus, its proximity to the Grove PATH train station ensures easy access to New York City, allowing you to make the most of your visit to the area.

43" HD smart TV in the room
neighborhood_overview:
Downtown Jersey City's Grove Street area is a vibrant and bustling neighborhood. It is known for its mix of residential, commercial, and entertainment offerings, making it a popular destination for residents and visitors alike.

Grove Street serves as the main hub of this neighborhood, lined with a variety of shops, restaurants, cafes, and bars. The area has a lively atmosphere with a diverse array of cuisines, ranging from cozy brunch spots to upscale dining experiences. It's a great place to explore and discover unique flavors from around the world.
One of the key attractions of the Grove Street area is its accessibility, particularly due to the presence of the Grove Street PATH train station. It provides convenient transportation options for residents commuting to Manhattan and other parts of New Jersey. It offers a direct connection to the World Trade Center in Lower Manhattan, making it a popular choice for professionals working in New York City.

You are
host_about: LiveWorkandMore--provides a home away from home, hotel-like hospitality experience for all your needs. Live like a local.

play ground for kids, Tennis court, baseball field. great for joggers and runners.

Located in the Bergen-Lafayette neighborhood, just outside of Downtown Jersey City. Two blocks from the light-rail train (LSP station) and 15 to 20 minutes to World Trade Center, New York City.

name: Bright 1.5BR near Grove St PATH
description: Well-located, charming, brightly lit, fully-furnished & equipped 1-BR apartment PLUS separate office in downtown Jersey City available for short-term sublets (1 week to 2 months) while I travel.  7 min walking to PATH train, 7 min into Manhattan.
neighborhood_overview: Downtown JC is THRIVING and this apartment on a main street that leads directly to the PATH train into Manhattan, with many restaurants/bars and other conveniences en route. neighborhood_overview:
Beautiful Lincoln Park is only a half block away and is part of the newly designated historic district. The park boasts river-front views, a 9-hole golf course, tennis courts, bird sanctuary, and a grand fountain recently restored to its original glory (designed by Pierre J. Cheron, it is the world's largest concrete monument!).

neighborhood_overview:
This is a cosmopolitan neighborhood. The Journal Square Path Station (Jersey City-Hoboken's subway system that connects us to Manhattan) is only 15 min walking distance away. We are very close to downtown Jersey City where you can find fancy restaurants and bars. Hoboken is also close by. Uber and the Citibike are affordable options to go to the Path Station and downtown, even to Hoboken. This studio is close to Manhattan and offers great value for those venturing into the city. If you are from the suburbs or small cities of the US with no traffic, no crowds, be prepared for big city life. It’s a safe neighborhood. My family and I have lived in this neighborhood for almost two decades. None of my tenants, guests or neighbors have had an issue about safety.
If you want a good value for your money, this is the right place for you!
STREET PARKING: If you are planning to come with a car, you're lucky if you can find a spot on the street. Jersey City is a highly populated city

Nestled in a vibrant Jersey City neighborhood, our chic apartment offers easy access to New York City, just a 15-minute subway ride or car journey away. With its unique blend of city life, local charm, historic architecture, and diverse culture, this neighborhood provides the perfect base for exploring Jersey City and NYC, all within walking reach.

Security video camera so you can feel secure at my property. Street parking requires a daily $5.00 permit from Monday through Friday). Cars are constantly moving around. neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights is a lively and safe neighborhood located in Jersey City, New Jersey, just across the Hudson River from Manhattan. Known for its vibrant atmosphere and scenic views, it has become a popular destination for residents and visitors alike.

One of the defining features of Jersey City Heights is its elevated location, which provides breathtaking panoramic views of the Manhattan skyline and the Hudson River. Residents and visitors can enjoy stunning vistas from various vantage points throughout the neighborhood, offering a unique perspective on the iconic New York City skyline.

The area offers a wide range of culinary options. From cozy cafes to trendy restaurants, you'll find an array of cuisines to satisfy your palate.

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey city has been noted as the most diversely populated city in the country.
It's a busy city but safe, short walk to the path train or bus terminal to take you to NYC in 10 mins. Popular fast food chains available locally, also some excellent independently owned restaurants. Feel free to ask for any suggestions. Newark avenue also known as little India is where you'll be transported into a street in Mumbai and get excellent cuisine. Downtown Jersey city offers some of the best cuisine and dining experiences on the East coast. TimeOut magazine has Ani Ramen, Batello, Dull boy and Hamilton Pork listed as best eats and the list goes on. The waterfront also offers an amazing view of the NYC skyline and additional dining options. With Lady Liberty on your left the ferries going into NYC are also a great sightseeing travel alternative. Liberty Science Center, liberty state park and Ellis island are also minutes away. With NYC as a famous backdrop Jersey City is also a very notable

This luxury community redefines sophisticated urban living with the comfort and style of home. Building amenities include a 24-hour doorman, fitness center, outdoor pool and resident lounge. Situated near the PATH train, Grove Pointe provides convenient commutes to NYC and other parts of New Jersey.
neighborhood_overview: Jersey City, located directly across the Hudson River from Lower Manhattan, offers the best of both worlds. Experience Jersey City's own culture, character and community, while having the option to commute into NYC in under 30-minutes via the PATH. With its proximity to Manhattan, Jersey City is popular among young professionals working in New York City looking for an alternative to living in one of the five boroughs. Downtown Jersey City, a major historical district, overlooks the Manhattan skyline. The historic neighborhood was once the first destination for immigrants entering through Ellis Island and still remains one of the most diverse areas of New Jersey. You'll find a vast array of food options from Korean, Indian, and Cuban as well as Italian Street Festivals.
host_about: Furnished Quarters has been helping people stay different for over 25 years. Driven by a passion for providing reliable short-term housing solutions worldwide, we aim to empower our guests with a seamless experience. Our prime locations in sought-after destinations, 24/7 guest service, expert design, and hand-picked furnishings in every one of our high-quality homes come together to create a simplified but sophisticated stay, every time.

name: Beautiful Garden Studio with Easy Access to NYC
description: Beautiful newly renovated studio close to New York City and fun New Jersey sights! Take the subway or bus to Manhattan in minutes (20-40 depending on traffic). Our studio is excellent for solo, couples, small family, or business travelers and there's everything you need to make your stay comfortable. We are a 12-minute car ride to the new American Dream mega mall! By staying with us, you're helping support two Broadway actors to pay their mortgage during these uncertain times.
neighborhood_overview:
Great restaurants downtown Jersey City (20 minute walk), cafes and shops are nearby as well. Parking option: 4 hours free on the street, for overnight parking we recommend the Journal Square Path subway which has a big lot, check online for current pricing ($18 a day last time I checked - no in and out).

There are also two Citi Bike Stations (Bike sharing program) within 5-7 minutes walk (Jefferson Avenue and Beacon Avenue). Great way to get around and there are stations downtown Jersey City, at Liberty State Park and all over so you can check out everything and not have to worry about parking.
host_about: Born and raised in Southern California, lived in New York City for 20 years, and now back in SoCal with my amazing husband. I love dogs, coffee and working out. I love singing and dancing and sometimes do it professionally.

name: Jersey City Victorian Home w/ Parking and Backyard
description: Victorian home with full renovation preserving the original details. Parquet floors, beautiful woodwork, backyard. New kitchen with premier appliances. Washer and dryer in basement. Great location, close to Journal Square Path Station only 20 minutes to NYC, Newark International Airport, Lincoln Park, Liberty State Park, Downtown Jersey City, and lots of restaurants, bars and cafes. Great home for family vacation. Jersey City Permit #STR-001029-2023.
neighborhood_overview: This is a residential neighborhood with very friendly families. There are plenty of places to walk to for eating and drinking.
host_about:
We are a family who loves to travel and experience new adventures. We are happy to call Jersey City our home during the school year, Hanoi our home during the summers and Shandaken our getaway in between. Whenever we can we head out into nature and try to eat new foods, which we then recreate in our own kitchen.

We have been staying at Airbnbs for years, and try to be the best hosts we can based on our own experiences. We will be very informative on what goes around in our neighborhood, and let you know the ins and outs of the area. We are friendly and easy to communicate with and want all our guests to have a memorable experience.  Nothing makes us happier than someone wanting to stay at our house again and again. We love our home and can't wait for others to enjoy it as well!

neighborhood_overview:
Journal Square is a vibrant and bustling neighborhood, known for its central transportation hub and rich cultural heritage.

At the heart of Journal Square is the Journal Square Transportation Center, a major transportation hub connecting various forms of transit, including buses, trains, and PATH (Port Authority Trans-Hudson) trains. This central location makes it a convenient hub for commuting to New York City and other parts of New Jersey, attracting a diverse range of residents and visitors.
Journal Square is a melting pot of cultures, offering a vibrant tapestry of ethnic diversity. This is reflected in the variety of cuisines, shops, and markets found throughout the neighborhood. From Indian and Middle Eastern eateries to Latin American and Caribbean flavors, there is no shortage of culinary delights to explore. You can also find an array of local shops, markets, and specialty stores that cater to diverse tastes and preferences.

neighborhood_overview: Jersey City is the second most populous city in the state of New Jersey. Located just across the Hudson River from Lower Manhattan, it’s part of the New York metropolitan area. The city’s architecture ranges from Industrial Age homes to classic brownstones to modern high rises. Downtown Jersey City, a major historical district, overlooks the Manhattan skyline. The waterfront section of the city is nicknamed “Wall Street West” for being home to several employers in the financial services, securities and insurance industries. The lofty office buildings, including the highly distinctive Goldman Sachs Tower, create a stunning skyline. With its proximity to Manhattan, Jersey City is popular among young professionals working in New York City looking for an alternative to living in one of the five boroughs. It is also one of the most ethnically diverse cities in the world, with large populations of Hispanic, Asian and Indian Americans. The Port Authority Trans-Hudson (PATH) train, a 24-hour s

name: Large studio w/workspace & garden-2 stops to NYC
description:
*Airbnb registered with the City of Jersey City
*Construction taking place nextdoor - could be loud during day
*Large ground floor spacious studio with private entrance & large garden
*Sparkling clean, fresh sheets & towels
*2 stops to Manhattan, Take the Grove Street Path [5 min walk]
*Walk Score 97 - close to parks, restaurants, bars, & supermarkets
*Families w/children welcome! Pack'n'Play available
*Perfect for working from home - Gigabit Verizon Fios internet, desk and 27" HD Monitor
neighborhood_overview:
Historic Downtown Jersey City is brimming with activity! With its close proximity to NYC, the area has seen a rapid development in the past 7 years and is now home to a diverse mix of locals, restaurants, bars and businesses. Just take a look on Yelp and you will find over 50 places to eat and drink at that are rated 4 STARS and above, all within a 10 minute walk from the apartment! In addition, there is Newport Mall nearby, which has a lot of shopping options (H&M, Zara, Coach, G-Star, Macys, Footlocker to name a few) a cinema and a diverse food court.

In our opinion, there are only 3 areas in New Jersey that are worth staying in if you are visiting NYC for a vacation or for business. Downtown Jersey City, Historic Jersey City and Hoboken due to their transport links to Manhattan, great local bars and restaurants, and for being known as incredibly safe areas.

Journal Square is still developing and very rough around the edges, with few bars and restaurants to
host_about: We are a married couple and finance professionals working in the NY/NJ area.  Originally from the UK, we moved to the US over 14 years ago and loved it so much that we stayed!  We have lived in downtown Jersey City for over 10 years.  We love travelling the world and trying out new foods.

name: Chic Large Family home! Quick train or bus to NYC!
description: Our hip urban home is a great base for your City adventures! Vibrant NYC vibe, family-friendly neighborhood, a short 20 min. walk to Journal Square transportation hub & many buses just one block away into NYC. Newark Airport is a 20 min drive or quick PATH trip. We live in the downstairs attached home, and are a legally owned & permitted Airbnb, which means you will never risk losing your booking with us because we are compliant with city laws! Ask about our extra bedroom/bath & parking spaces!
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City is a gem with the best view of the Manhattan skyline and a 7 min drive to the Statue of Liberty! Hoboken, home of Carlo's Bakery, is our next door neighbor. Our neighborhood is especially family friendly and walkable. Enjoy tennis, picnicking, bike trails and multiple playgrounds, all within a 3-minute walk from your home away from home. Just around the corner is a Catholic church, an array of ethnic eateries, a Dairy Queen, convenience stores, fruitstands, hair salons, etc.

We are also close to Liberty State Park, where you can catch a ferry to the Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, or to NYC!
host_about:
We are the parents of three young adults, and former foster parents; Mike is a professor and Kennan teaches at a cancer hospital in NYC. We consider ourselves to be committed to our community. 
We speak Spanish (though we are rusty).  Kennan can sign (though she is rusty too). But we would love to get some practice. 
We find great joy in hosting people and families from all over the world!

name: Stylish Apt 40 mins from NYC - TV/Laundry/Parking
description:
Monthly renters welcome.

Rent this tastefully decorated, sun drenched one bedroom urban apartment 40 minutes away from Manhattan. One parking spot on site. Located near light rail train in the bustling Bergen-Lafayette section of Jersey City, this unit features a plush queen bed, an extra air mattress, 49" LED TV, WiFi, fully equipped kitchen, walk-in shower, and in-unit laundry. Street parking usually available. You will be steps away from parks and trendy restaurants.
neighborhood_overview:
Bergen-Lafayette is an urban neighborhood offering a diverse mix of residents, sights, and activities. This is a decent neighborhood and is generally safe. Please remember you are in Jersey City, not all of its streets are lined with charming brownstones and upscale restaurants. Some blocks, like ours, will give you extra entertainment in the form of the occasional loud boombox or kids playing lively games of hide and seek on the street.

Uber is very popular in Jersey City, and a ride between the apartment and the PATH station at Exchange Place in Downtown won't cost more than $10. They will take a group of 4 people, which means your cost per-person will be lower than the $2.5 light rail ticket. If you haven't used Uber before, let me know and I will send you an invite which comes with a small discount.

neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City Heights is a lively and safe neighborhood located in Jersey City, New Jersey, just across the Hudson River from Manhattan. Known for its vibrant atmosphere and scenic views, it has become a popular destination for residents and visitors alike.

One of the defining features of Jersey City Heights is its elevated location, which provides breathtaking panoramic views of the Manhattan skyline and the Hudson River. Residents and visitors can enjoy stunning vistas from various vantage points throughout the neighborhood, offering a unique perspective on the iconic New York City skyline.

The area offers a wide range of culinary options. From cozy cafes to trendy restaurants, you'll find an array of cuisines to satisfy your palate.

• Modern one-bedroom/one-bathroom apartment
• Open-concept living area with fully equipped kitchen
• Washer and dryer
• Professionally cleaned between each stay
• Located on tree-lined street in downtown Jersey City
• Short walk to PATH train into Manhattan

neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located in the historic neighborhood of Hamilton Park in downtown Jersey City. The apartment is two blocks away from the park, which has tennis courts, a basketball court, a large playground, plenty of tree-shaded grassy areas for a picnic, and a farmer’s market on Wednesdays from May through November.

Newark Avenue, a pedestrian-only street with lots of trendy restaurants and bars, is an 8-minute walk away.

The Newport Mall, with plenty of shopping options and a large movie theater, is three blocks away.

There are a number of restaurants, as well as some great ice cream shops and several local coffee shops, within close walking distance. There are also two grocery stores located within five blocks of the apartment (ShopRite and Key Food).

name: Spacious 4BR home 30 mins* from NY! Parking avail!
description:
Perfect home for a getaway or events around NYC: 30 mins to NYC*. 4 Bedroom, 2.5 Bath. Sleeps 6-12. Private coded entrance. 2 stories.

Our home was built in 2017 and is filled with all the amenities you need! As NYC is vast, times vary for transportation. 25 mins from World Trade Center, 45 mins from Times Square, 20 mins from Newark, 15 mins from American Dream.

Extra $25/day 2-car max parking available with advance notice. Large vans are $40.

JC Short Term Rental Permit STR-005297-2024
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City is close to NYC and has a variety of public transportation options. Neighboring Hoboken and downtown Jersey City are both easy 15 minute walks and have plenty of lovely options for dining and entertainment. 20 minutes from Newark airport.

We are 6 miles from MetLife stadium, home to the Giants and Jets. Appr. 15 minutes via Uber or car.

We provide maps and bus/train instructions for NYC travel. The fastest to Herald Square (Macys's) is (a) 16 min walk to PATH at Journal Square, then 20 min train to 33rd street. Or take 3 minute bus to PATH for faster service. PATH drops at Christopher Street, 9th street, 14th street (Union Square), 23rd street and 33rd street (Macy's). There is also a separate Path Service line directly to the World Trade Center (about 10 minutes on the train).

There are also direct buses that get you to Times Square (Port Authority) in about 35 to 45 minutes that pickup directly outside of our street.
host_about: Hello future friends - my husband, Ted, and I love traveling the world. (So much that we have been to Norway, New Orleans, London, Maine, Austin, Nashville, Toronto, Hawaii, Croatia, Venice, Switzerland, South Africa, Alaska, Portland and Napa in recent years.)  I hail from the midwest (Wisconsin) and love ice cream, cheese and the Packers.  Ted is from Brooklyn and knows everything about NYC + he was an MLB baseball player. We live for country music, half marathons and live music.  We hope to see you at our home or yours! Our goal as Airbnb hosts is to give a purely local and delightful home-away-from-home. See you soon!

name: ⭐Minutes to NYC⭐ Brownstone beauty | FREE PARKING
description:
Urban energy, brownstone charm! Welcome to bustling Journal Square in Jersey City!

We renovated our beautiful 19th century brownstone and installed brand-new everything. The front spacious master bedroom has a queen bed and a sitting area; the rear smaller bedroom has a full size bed that looks out onto our quiet and serene backyard. Since we live downstairs we're happy to help make your stay as pleasant as possible. We are fully licensed PERMIT# STR-002758-2024
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood is very safe and family friendly. Like NYC, the neighborhood is cultural diversity. Jersey City has been gentrifying for the last few years.  We have seen an influx of young professionals and families like ourselves move into this beautiful, vibrant city. We have lived in Jersey City for nine years with our three young kids (6,8,10) and Tim's family has been here for 100+ years.

A couple of blocks from us is an elementary school, catholic high school, Saint Peter's University, churches, and the New Jersey National Guard Armory.

There is a grocery store, wine shop, diners/restaurants right around the corner. One of the best bagel places in the NYC/NJ area is just a few blocks away. An amazing local favorite breakfast spot, Cafe Alice is a block from us. Little India, a 15-minute walk away, has some of the best restaurants around and there are plenty of dining options closer to Journal Square.

Our house is:
-1/2 mile (7 blocks) f
host_about:
When we are not busy raising and hanging out with our kids (7,9,11) we love to travel and being outdoors. Some of our favorite places - beautiful aqua blue/turquoise water and white sandy beaches in Kailua in Hawaii, Koster Islands in Sweden and Galway in Ireland.

We have been hosting for over seven years now.  Our hosting experience has definitely expanded our worldview, and deep appreciation of other cultures.

The neighborhood has experienced a revitalization, with new businesses, restaurants, and cultural venues sprouting up. Local entrepreneurs have opened trendy coffee shops, art galleries, and boutiques, adding to the neighborhood's vibrancy. This blend of old and new creates a dynamic and evolving landscape that appeals to both longtime residents and newcomers alike.
Bergen-Lafayette also boasts a thriving food scene, with an array of culinary options reflecting the diverse cultural influences present in the area. You can find everything from traditional soul food to global cuisine, making it a destination for food lovers seeking unique dining experiences.

The neighborhood's green spaces are another highlight. name: 72 "2" Private room by light rail/bus to NYC/WIFI
description:
Cozy private room available in a vibrant neighborhood of Jersey City, perfect for both work and relaxation. The room features a comfortable double bed, and a computer desk for work or study.

Located just minutes from public transportation, it's an easy commute to both Jersey City Downtown and New York City via LIghtrail/PATH trains and buses.
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood has experienced a revitalization, with new businesses, restaurants, and cultural venues sprouting up. Local entrepreneurs have opened trendy coffee shops, art galleries, and boutiques, adding to the neighborhood's vibrancy. This blend of old and new creates a dynamic and evolving landscape that appeals to both longtime residents and newcomers alike.
Bergen-Lafayette also boasts a thriving food scene, with an array of culinary options reflecting the diverse cultural influences present in the area. You can find everything from traditional soul food to global cuisine, making it a destination for food lovers seeking unique dining experiences.

The neighborhood's green spaces are another highlight. Berry Lane Park, a large and beautifully designed public park, provides a tranquil oasis where residents can enjoy outdoor activities, picnics, and community gatherings. It serves as a hub for recreational opportunities and offers a respite from the bustling city.<
host_about: LiveWorkandMore--provides a home away from home, hotel-like hospitality experience for all your needs. Live like a local.

name: Million Dollar View Private Suite Self Contained
description: Experience a 5-star getaway like no other! This stunning retreat offers breathtaking views that will leave you speechless. Enjoy your own private living area and bathroom in a meticulously maintained sanctuary, designed for your comfort and relaxation. With recent renovations enhancing the scenery, this is your perfect escape. Treat yourself to a luxurious experience and make unforgettable memories. Book now to immerse yourself in this serene oasis!
neighborhood_overview:
This is a great neighborhood only a very short walk to Hoboken which proudly has some of the best bars/restaurants in the region as well as a boardwalk along the Hudson River with unmatched views of the city. You have a mix of feeling like you are in a big city while still having a quiet place to retreat to at the end of the day.

You have very easy and quick access to Manhattan by bus, train or ferry as well as to MetLife Stadium for all the major sporting events and to American Dream Mall - the second largest shoppping and entertainment mall in the USA.
host_about: I am Australian born but have lived in this beautiful neighborhood for the past 15 years. I have worked in the travel industry for the past 31 years and I know what guests look for when they travel. New York is one of the world's most incredible cities, but visitors need to have a safe haven where they can escape to re-energize during their stay. I’m very proud of the space I’ve created and I look forward to welcoming you soon.

Don’t hesitate to book w/ us! We are in compliance with the new JC Airbnb ordinance law :)

name: The Cook's Brickhouse *Walk to PATH!
description:
This stylish 2 BR renovated historic house is 20min to Manhattan/15min from Newark Airport. Take the 24-hr PATH (8 min walk) or Bus 51 (3min walk ) to NYC.
Shop markets and cook in the chef's kitchen with 6-burner Bluestar stove or the Weber grills in the yard with organic veggie garden, bamboo forest and fruit trees. Soak in the clawfoot tub or check books from the cook's library.
There’s a 28 night minimum. Inquire for longer stays.
Please introduce yourself & tell me about your visit.
neighborhood_overview:
Check out my guidebook for recommendations!
The Journal Square area is old and gaining ground with occasional classic films playing at the historic Loews Theater across from the Path Station.
•The Mana Contemporary Art Center is around the corner.
•Square 1 Community cafe is 2 doors down serving excellent food and coffees, drinks etc.
•Little India is a block away with shopping, fresh food, butchers and excellent restaurants.
•Convenience stores like the Dollar Store, a liquor store and small ethnic markets are easily available. There are ashrams as well and a yoga studio.
•Grove Street (Path station stop) is chock full of new restaurants that are delicious and now pedestrian in some areas. Shops and nightlife abound if you decide to stay in Jersey City. Jivamukti has an excellent yoga studio there as well.
•Exchange Place (Path station) has a direct ferry to Brookside Place (near WTC and the Oculus).
•Liberty State Park is a short ride away an
host_about: I'm Chinese American and have lived in many countries and think being in a comfortable stylish home beats a hotel. I'm a writer, food stylist, herbalist and professional cook  so having a meal or two at home from the local market always makes a visit more special. I have scoured  my neighborhoods and will be one of your best bets to find the best restaurants and overall where to go off the tour circuit.

name: The Brick Vault--Walk to Path!
description:
Extremely convenient and comfortable! You'll love staying in my newly renovated space called the "vault' because it is safe and grounding. This small beautifully renovated oasis is 20min to NYC, 15min to Newark airport. The Path train station (8min) and Times Square bus (3min ) run 24hrs.
Enjoy a comfortably furnished living space with a deep soaking tub, large screen TV, washer /dryer and loaded kitchen in a great neighborhood. Just bring yourself!
neighborhood_overview:
A block away are excellent Indian eateries including dosa huts and a special place featuring in egg curries featured in Eater.com
The Mana Art Center is a few minutes away on foot.
Loew's is an old revival theater that will, on occasion, show 35mm vintage films in their original glory-- a real treat!
Boulevard Drinks has THE best hot dogs!
Bread and Salt is delicious casual Italian and a quick Uber/Lyft on Palisade Ave written on Eater.com and upcoming Bon Appetit issue/website.
Take a look at the local guidebook I've created.

name: Urban Sanctuary: 1 Stop To NYC, 2 BR w Cool Yard
description:
Beautifully decorated, spotlessly clean garden level apartment in the best neighborhood in Jersey City. Only 1 stop to Manhattan/NYC/Hoboken!
BOOK WITH CONFIDENCE: This airbnb is LEGAL w all permits and inspected by the city for your safety. There are many illegal airbnbs out there don’t let shady hosts ruin your stay. Legal ones have Registration Number with current year on the listing.
neighborhood_overview:
We love our neighborhood for the perfect balance of walkability, diversity, and livability. Smart travelers already know Downtown Jersey City is closer to Manhattan than 95% of Queens and Brooklyn with considerably less crowds. Plus our mayor is young and progressive and fully legalized airbnb in 2015, unlike NYC where is very much illegal for short term rentals. Our waterfront has one of the most picturesque views of lower Manhattan, New York Harbor and Statue of Liberty.

The apartment is two short blocks away from Hamilton Park surrounded by gorgeous brownstones and 19th century rowhouses, and it is adorned with impressive 100+ year old trees and lush glass within that often serve as gathering place for locals and visitors alike - the park hosts weekly farmers market, seasonal movie screenings, barbecue festivals, tennis and basketball courts, just to name a few.

Many shopping and restaurants options are all walking distance from the apartment and a
host_about: Grew up in NYC, settled down in Jersey City.   I worked in tech, ran a wine shop, am a classically trained cook and social media hermit.   While first hosting airbnb I realized hospitality and food have been my calling all along so I work very hard everyday towards perfecting my craft while trying to be the best family man I can be.

name: Stylish & Clean Room near NYC!* Long term
description:
Clean, quiet and safe room in the fantastic neighborhood of Jersey City Heights. Quick 30 minute bus ride to Time Square Also cheap Uber ride to Hoboken, with direct PATH train to the city. The brand new apartment is stylishly decorated for your enjoyment. The room features a Smart TV and a DESK with a chair. The bathrooms are very clean, and WIFI is available throughout. The apartment is equipped with central cooling/heating system, washer/dryer.
For LONGTERM stays only (over 28 days)!
neighborhood_overview: Just across the river from Manhattan, Jersey City is considered the sixth borough of New York City. There are frequent buses to Times Square just a short walk away from the apartment. Buses run every 10 minutes. There are plenty of local restaurants nearby with diverse and delicious cuisine.
host_about:
Hi, I'm Miz!

I have lived in the NYC area for 8 years, and have been sharing my space (now spaces!) with guests since 2014. I love hosting!

I grew up in Houston, Texas, went to college in Pennsylvania, and spent time living in Italy, Spain, and Australia before moving to NYC. I currently live in Jersey City.

I am a real estate agent and property manager, and in my spare time I enjoy long walks in the neighborhood, wandering around NYC, all the self-care (massages, facials, yoga), and eating out (plus a good cocktail) with friends. 

I'm an avid traveler and have stayed with friends all over the world. I love to get a local experience when I travel, so I'm happy to provide that for my guests. My partner Mario and I host together, so you may hear or see him as well! 

Any and all questions welcome! I want to make sure you have a great time in Jersey City & NYC.

name: Lovely private bed/bath Paulus Hook, Jersey City
description:
Dear Airbnb Searchers,
We offer self check-in. But ideally I will be here to let you in.

Street parking is pretty easy to find. (I provide visitor permits for $10/day). A visitor permit is needed Mon. - Fri. from 10am - 5pm. On Thursdays you shouldn't park on our side, there will be street cleaning. No permit needed on weekends/holidays.
neighborhood_overview:
We love the Paulus Hook neighborhood. We are five blocks from the Hudson River! The Freedom Tower in lower Manhattan is visible to the east as you stand in front of our house. There are convenient coffee and breakfast places just a couple of blocks away. I highly recommend the Light Horse Tavern, Amelia's, Taqueria, and Sam a.m. (for breakfast), four of many great restaurants within a few blocks of our house.

Practically anything you want is really less than a 15 minute walk away! More excellent restaurants for foodies, specialty grocery stores, bakeries, live music, etc. I'm happy to provide recommendations for any activity or shopping need you may have.
host_about: I was a costume designer, and now create quilts, bags and do tailoring and alterations.  I am married to Tom, a retired architect. We have two daughters who live in NYC and Upstate NY.  Our son is an artist who lives in Bali.

name: A Private Garden Getaway Minutes From Manhattan
description: Spacious, impeccably clean apartment with private entrance and yard.  Experience your visit in style in this modern, cozy split-level studio in the heart of downtown Jersey City--  close to area airports and 7 minutes to NYC.   A perfect location, centrally located and within walking distance of stores and restaurants.  Beautifully furnished and meticulously cleaned and sanitized top to bottom between guests. Truly the perfect place to make your next visit a smooth, happy, and  memorable one.
neighborhood_overview: We're right in the heart of downtown Jersey City.   There's a terrific deli a few doors down, the best bagels EVER a block away and a French bakery around the corner.   We're 2 blocks from the local restaurant row, which is dotted with great places to eat and drink.  We're close to  grocery and drug stores and even have a spa across the street!  There are three beautiful parks within walking distance, including Liberty State Park which has ferry service to Ellis Island and The Statue of Liberty.   Everything you need is within walking distance.

name: 2BR Brownstone  by NYC Free Parking & PrivateEntry
description:
This stay will comfortably fit a family or friends where you can relax after long days in NYC. Our 150 year old brownstone has great charm and character yet recently renovated to be cozy and modern.

A short walk to the Light Rail station connecting to WTC/NYC subways via PATH Trains or the Ferry. Nearby coffee shops, restaurants and groceries. We are just outside the lovely Liberty State Park for those who love the great outdoors. Walking distance to the Statue of Liberty ferry 🗽🇺🇸
neighborhood_overview:
The house is located a short walk to a train connecting to NYC. Hop on the light rail train to Exchange Place and transfer to PATH or ferry to NYC from there. Exchange Place offers the most breathtaking view of NYC you can’t miss!!

The house is also within walking distance to Liberty State Park which is a 1200 acre park offering dramatic views of Manhattan, Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island!

Walking distance to the iconic Statue of Liberty ferry (30 minute to be exact).

Commute using public transport into downtown NYC takes 35 minutes including all walk, train transfers and wait times during normal hours.

Our neighborhood is called Bergen Lafayette affectionately known as BeLa. It is located just outside downtown Jersey City (about 20 minute walk or a few minute drive). It is an urban neighborhood with diverse residents. Hard working families with young children live here. Many like next door neighbors have been here for over 50
host_about: I’ve lived in Jersey City for 25 years now.  I love its diversity and energy.  2 dogs (3 most times since we often foster dogs from overcrowded shelters), 3 cats and a kid.  It is a handful but we love it.

name: 3 bed 2.5 bath + 1 Parking! Home away from Home
description: Our property, Urban Base Camp, is a comfortable air-conditioned 3-bedroom with 2 full bath rooms and a half bath space and is located in Jersey City across the Hudson River from Manhattan.  This beautiful space is 1650 sq feet and was renovated in 2018. Cleanliness is very important to us, included in your monthly rate is a cleaning every 2 weeks.
neighborhood_overview:
Our property is a 7 minute walk to the Grove Street PATH train station which provides transportation to New York City, Newark Airport, Hoboken, etc. Depending on your destination, it is an approximately 10-20 minutes commute on the PATH train to Manhattan.

Jersey City is a melting pot of international influences from its residents to its varied and appetizing culinary options - Korean, Indian, Filipino, Cuban, Italian, and American.

The Statue of Liberty and Ellis Islands are less than ½ mile away from Liberty State Park’s ferry dock. Liberty Science Center is a 10 minutes drive from Urban Base Camp. There are beautiful green spaces - Hamilton Park, Van Vorst Park, and Liberty Park - where kids can frolic and play, where you can walk, run, and cycle, take a picnic and gaze upon Manhattan’s skyline. The Newport area - one stop from Grove PATH station - offers you a mall, large stores, and a beautiful waterfront walkway.

Major highways are easily accessib

name: The Alana - A Chic Duplex 40 Minutes from NYC
description:
Welcome to The Alana, a newly renovated flat in the bustling Bergen Lafayette section of Jersey City. Filled with natural light, this tastefully furnished space features two floors, 4 bedrooms / 2 baths, a fully equipped kitchen, and in-unit washer and dryer. Travel to Manhattan via PATH trains, reachable by Uber or via the Light Rail two blocks away - total trip time will be 30-40 minutes.

Monthly renters welome.
neighborhood_overview:
While the majority of our guests come to see NYC, we urge you to explore Jersey City’s beautiful Bergen Lafayette as well. Within 10 minutes of the apartment you will find an array of hip new restaurants, bars, and cafes located on the evolving Communipaw Avenue. Grind Coffee Shop is a must if you are a coffee fan. Three blocks from the house is the new Berry Lane Park - host to regular soccer matches and tennis games. Don’t forget to visit Downtown Jersey City for local gems like Torico Ice Cream Shop and Taqueria Downtown.

Bergen-Lafayette is an urban neighborhood offering a diverse mix of residents, sights, and activities. This is a decent neighborhood and is generally safe. Please remember you are in Jersey City, not all of its streets are lined with charming brownstones and upscale restaurants. Some blocks, like ours, will give you extra entertainment in the form of the occasional loud boombox or kids playing lively games of hide and seek on the street.

Agai
host_about: Passionate traveler & Airbnb host.  Love all things design.

description:
Clean, quiet and safe room in the fantastic neighborhood of Jersey City Heights. Quick 30 minute bus ride to Time Square, easily accessible from the apartment. Also cheap Uber ride to Hoboken, with direct PATH train to the city. The brand new apartment is stylishly decorated for your enjoyment. The room features a Smart TV. neighborhood_overview: Just across the river from Manhattan, Jersey City is considered the sixth borough of New York City. host_about:
Hi, I'm Miz!

I have lived in the NYC area for 8 years, and have been sharing my space (now spaces!) with guests since 2014. I love hosting!

I grew up in Houston, Texas, went to college in Pennsylvania, and spent time living in Italy, Spain, and Australia before moving to NYC. I currently live in Jersey City.

I am a real estate agent and property manager, and in my spare time I enjoy long walks in the neighborhood, wandering around NYC, all the self-care (massages, facials, yoga), and eating out (plus a good cocktail) with friends. 

I'm an avid traveler and have stayed with friends all over the world. I love to get a local experience when I travel, so I'm happy to provide that for my guests. My partner Mario and I host together, so you may hear or see him as well! 

Any and all questions welcome! I want to make sure you have a great time in Jersey City & NYC.

name: Coco Loft/The Heights, JC
description:
This is a private bedroom with a secure lock located in a historic Jersey City row house. Guests have a comfy queen size bed, and a fold out single size bed. Sleeps 3 people comfortably.

*Note: Guests only have access to the bedroom and the bathroom on the second level. Guests are not allowed in the rest of the house including the kitchen.

* Note: This room is ideal for 2-3 people, but can sleep up to four.

* Thirty - forty minutes away from Midtown New York City via bus or train.
neighborhood_overview:
Jersey City is the 6th borough of NYC and super convenient to Manhattan. The house is two blocks away from Central Ave. This is a street full of cheap shopping, restaurants, coffee shops all along the sidewalk. You also will catch the bus to Port Authority in NYC here.

There is also Riverview Park park located four blocks away on 498 Palisade Ave. If you want to go for a scenic walk definitely include this! There a farmers market at Riverview Park which is held every Sunday (rain or shine) from the first Sunday in May through the Sunday before Thanksgiving in November, from 10 am to 3 pm.
host_about: We are a husband and wife team in Jersey City and have been hosting our home outside of the NYC area for the last several years. We love hosting travelers from all over the world. We are here to make sure you have an amazing stay. Welcome home, enjoy your stay!

name: Bright, Stylish Garden Apartment minutes to NYC
description: Welcome to our garden apartment in Jersey City. Perfect for tourists trying to see NYC on a budget or for a longer term sublet, our brand new, one bedroom/ one bath is comfortable, stylish and fully stocked. Located in a safe, quiet residential street, it is a perfect place to relax after a day in the city.  Only 3 blocks to the Path train to WTC (in 12 minutes) and Midtown (in 22 minutes) which runs 24/7, making all tourist attractions and shopping very convenient. Groceries, restaurants, etc.
neighborhood_overview:
Our street is primarily young families, very quiet and safe, so please no loud parties. It is as close as you can be to the Path into Manhattan (3 blocks) and walking distance to all the amazing restaurants and bars downtown without the noise.
Please ask us about where to go, we are happy to share our insiders' knowledge.
host_about:
My husband and I have lived in Jersey City for 20 years.  We love our area because of its convenience to NYC. In fact, my colleagues that live in Brooklyn take longer to get to work than I do!  
We love to travel with our three young daughters and love to stay in Airbnbs.  As a host I try to provide anything that I would want to have when traveling. We want to make your stay as comfortable and enjoyable as possible.  From advice on where to go or eat, to breakfast items for our late night arrivals... always something to make you feel welcome!

description:
🌟 Cozy 3BR/2Bath Apt – 20 Min from NYC 🌟

Welcome! I offer two private rooms for Airbnb guests while I stay in the third with my own bathroom.

neighborhood_overview:
🏙️ Prime Location:

Nestled in the heart of Jersey City, this neighborhood perfectly blends urban energy with residential comfort.

Just minutes from Manhattan, it offers easy access to the city’s vibrant life while maintaining a peaceful and relaxed atmosphere.

🌆 Views and Atmosphere:

Located on the iconic JFK Boulevard, surrounded by a mix of classic and modern architecture.

Enjoy a safe and friendly neighborhood, ideal for exploring on foot or using public transportation.

🍴 Local Food Scene:

A wide variety of restaurants just steps away, from authentic Latin and Asian cuisine to classic diners and cozy cafes.

Nearby recommendations: Rumba Cubana (authentic Cuban food), Miss America Diner (classic American dishes), and Dulce de Leche Bakery for sweet treats.

neighborhood_overview:
Located just across the Hudson River from New York City, some refer to Jersey City as the sixth borough. Overlooking Hoboken and the Manhattan skyline, Jersey City Heights is a go-to spot for tourists.
Due to its location, one hundred feet above sea level on the western side of the Hudson River, residents get to enjoy beautiful scenic views of the Manhattan skyline from one side and beautiful marshes and meadowlands on the other side. Variety of public transportation options like the PATH Train, New Jersey Transit’s  Light Rail, and public buses make your traveling to New York City, downtown Jersey City, or Hoboken quick and convenient. Take the stairs off Paterson Plank Road to Hoboken’s 2nd Street Light Rail Station or the elevator at Congress Street to the 9th Street Light Rail Station to easily commute around Hoboken, Weehawken, Jersey City, Bayonne and beyond! New Jersey Transit bus routes also serve this neighborhood, with several major lines to help you zip around locally

neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood has experienced a revitalization, with new businesses, restaurants, and cultural venues sprouting up. Local entrepreneurs have opened trendy coffee shops, art galleries, and boutiques, adding to the neighborhood's vibrancy. This blend of old and new creates a dynamic and evolving landscape that appeals to both longtime residents and newcomers alike.
Bergen-Lafayette also boasts a thriving food scene, with an array of culinary options reflecting the diverse cultural influences present in the area. You can find everything from traditional soul food to global cuisine, making it a destination for food lovers seeking unique dining experiences.

The neighborhood's green spaces are another highlight. Berry Lane Park, a large and beautifully designed public park, provides a tranquil oasis where residents can enjoy outdoor activities, picnics, and community gatherings. It serves as a hub for recreational opportunities and offers a respite from the bustling city.<

neighborhood_overview: Jersey City, located directly across the Hudson River from Lower Manhattan, offers the best of both worlds. Experience Jersey City's own culture, character and community, while having the option to commute into NYC in under 30-minutes via the PATH. With its proximity to Manhattan, Jersey City is popular among young professionals working in New York City looking for an alternative to living in one of the five boroughs. Downtown Jersey City, a major historical district, overlooks the Manhattan skyline. The historic neighborhood was once the first destination for immigrants entering through Ellis Island and still remains one of the most diverse areas of New Jersey. You'll find a vast array of food options from Korean, Indian, and Cuban as well as Italian Street Festivals.

neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood has experienced a revitalization, with new businesses, restaurants, and cultural venues sprouting up. Local entrepreneurs have opened trendy coffee shops, art galleries, and boutiques, adding to the neighborhood's vibrancy. This blend of old and new creates a dynamic and evolving landscape that appeals to both longtime residents and newcomers alike.
Bergen-Lafayette also boasts a thriving food scene, with an array of culinary options reflecting the diverse cultural influences present in the area. You can find everything from traditional soul food to global cuisine, making it a destination for food lovers seeking unique dining experiences.

The neighborhood's green spaces are another highlight. Berry Lane Park, a large and beautifully designed public park, provides a tranquil oasis where residents can enjoy outdoor activities, picnics, and community gatherings. It serves as a hub for recreational opportunities and offers a respite from the bustling city.<

neighborhood_overview: Jersey City, located directly across the Hudson River from Lower Manhattan, offers the best of both worlds. Experience Jersey City's own culture, character and community, while having the option to commute into NYC in under 30-minutes via the PATH. With its proximity to Manhattan, Jersey City is popular among young professionals working in New York City looking for an alternative to living in one of the five boroughs. Downtown Jersey City, a major historical district, overlooks the Manhattan skyline. The historic neighborhood was once the first destination for immigrants entering through Ellis Island and still remains one of the most diverse areas of New Jersey. You'll find a vast array of food options from Korean, Indian, and Cuban as well as Italian Street Festivals.

description: Amazing 3 bedroom apartment in a historic brownstone steps from the Grove Street PATH train. Two stops into Manhattan! Enjoy your stay in the hottest area in Downtown Jersey City! neighborhood_overview: Jersey City is an exciting and charming neighborhood full of tons of activities for everyone. Great restaurants and cafes are just outside the door of the apartment. Regular events take place outside on Newark Ave. Enjoy all Jersey City has to offer!
host_about:
Hi, I'm Miz!

I have lived in the NYC area for 8 years, and have been sharing my space (now spaces!) with guests since 2014. I love hosting!

I grew up in Houston, Texas, went to college in Pennsylvania, and spent time living in Italy, Spain, and Australia before moving to NYC. I currently live in Jersey City.

I am a real estate agent and property manager, and in my spare time I enjoy long walks in the neighborhood, wandering around NYC, all the self-care (massages, facials, yoga), and eating out (plus a good cocktail) with friends. 

I'm an avid traveler and have stayed with friends all over the world. I love to get a local experience when I travel, so I'm happy to provide that for my guests. My partner Mario and I host together, so you may hear or see him as well! 

Any and all questions welcome! I want to make sure you have a great time in Jersey City & NYC.

name: Nice Private Apartment/WIFI/5 min walk Path Train
description: Located in the Journal Square area, this bright and clean 1-bedroom apartment offers easy access to everything you need. The apartment features a queen bed and a queen sleeper sofa, comfortably accommodating up to 4 people. Stay connected with fast WIFI throughout your stay.
neighborhood_overview:
Journal Square is a vibrant and bustling neighborhood, known for its central transportation hub and rich cultural heritage.

At the heart of Journal Square is the Journal Square Transportation Center, a major transportation hub connecting various forms of transit, including buses, trains, and PATH (Port Authority Trans-Hudson) trains. This central location makes it a convenient hub for commuting to New York City and other parts of New Jersey, attracting a diverse range of residents and visitors.
Journal Square is a melting pot of cultures, offering a vibrant tapestry of ethnic diversity. This is reflected in the variety of cuisines, shops, and markets found throughout the neighborhood. From Indian and Middle Eastern eateries to Latin American and Caribbean flavors, there is no shortage of culinary delights to explore. name: Historical Downtown Jersey City apartment near NYC
description:
Welcome to Heritage House, Apartment #3.

Occupying the top floor of a lovingly restored, historical brownstone in the heart of the city, our home offers a blend of accessibility and privacy. Located on a charming residential street that's a short walk to bars, restaurants, and shopping - our home is near everything Jersey City has to offer. Whatever your interests are, you'll find it here!
neighborhood_overview:
Located in Hudson County, NJ—Jersey City is where urban excitement meets small town charm. Nestled along the west bank of the Hudson River, this cosmopolitan center is surrounded by bustling cities like NYC, Hoboken, and Weehawken.

Within Jersey City itself, Historic Downtown beckons with a delightful mix of historic brownstones and sleek waterfront high-rises, blending old-world charm with modern allure. Here in our downtown neighborhood, the community spirit thrives—expect warm smiles and perhaps a friendly chat with neighbors. Recognized as the “Most Diverse City” in the USA, our vibrant city offers a rich cultural tapestry through its myriad of parks, cafes, restaurants, bars, and shops.

Engage in some dog-watching or pick up produce at nearby parks, where Victorian elegance meets farmers markets. Explore Hamilton Park, named after Founding Father Alexander Hamilton and Van Vorst Park, honoring former Mayor Cornelius Van Vorst. Just a short stroll away, disc
host_about:
Hello! I'm a lifelong resident of NJ but split my time between my homes in Jersey City, NJ  and Adirondack Park, NY. I love meeting people, new experiences, and traveling.

In my free time, I pursue random creative and outdoor hobbies. In my not-so-free time, I'm an Executive Advisor who specializes in leadership and management.

name: Stylish Apt with Balcony and Patio - 20 mins to NY
description: Recently renovated, beautifully furnished garden level apartment in downtown Jersey City. Enjoy the peace, quiet and safety of the apartment’s residential street or explore the restaurants and shops of Newark Ave just a block away. Also a 10-minute walk from the PATH which takes you to downtown Manhattan (World Trade Center) in 7 minutes and to midtown Manhattan (33rd St and 6th Ave) in 19 minutes. 20 minute drive to Newark Liberty International Airport
neighborhood_overview:
Downtown Jersey City is an excellent place to explore in its own right. Within a 15 minute walk you will find more than 30 excellent restaurants including Razza (the best Pizza in NYC, according to the NY Times), Taqueria Downtown (best tacos in NJ, according to us!) and cuisines from all over the world. We also have a thriving art scene with lots of street art; ask Kevin for tips =)
It's only a 20 min walk to the waterfront at Exchange Place where you will have jaw dropping views of Manhattan across the river; there are a few excellent dining options there as well such as Hudson & Co, Lokal JC and DomoDomo.
host_about: Aneliya and I are always looking for interesting conversation and enjoy sharing our home with others. She’s originally from Pleven, Bulgaria while I’m a city boy from Caracas, Venezuela. We’ve lived in Jersey City for 11 years and are very glad to give suggestions on where to eat, drink, etc.

name: Jersey City Suites- Steps from Transit to NYC
description: Welcome to your home away from home! Our property is located in Jersey City within two minutes of the Light Rail, which can connect you to The Liberty Science Center, Liberty State Park, Hoboken, and Manhattan. The guests' spaces include two private bedrooms with natural light and Roku Tv, as well as, a full private bathroom. Shared spaces include a complete eat-in kitchen, 1/2 bathroom, and a comfortable living room area. Additionally, wifi access will be made available. Hope to see you soon!
host_about:
Hi!,
We are Hassan and Patricia: a young entrepreneurial couple with big hearts and even bigger dreams. On a day to day, Hassan works in the historic Waldorf Astoria as a Concierge Manager while I [Patricia] work as a residential Interior Designer throughout NYC. After hosting for a combined seven years on Airbnb, we have fallen in love with the community that this platform facilitates and are very proud of earning our Superhost badge as we truly put a lot of care into providing our guests with a comfortable home away from home. 

This past year we decided to purchase our first home in Jersey City, ( just a hop and skip away from our hometown of NYC) and, naturally, we are bringing along our Airbnb community on this new venture. 

We look forward to meeting you !

Hassan and Patricia

host_about:
I'm an easy-going guy who loves to travel and enjoy the world around him. I often travel for work, thus leaving my apartment available to guests visiting the area (JC, NYC, Newark, etc). I joined AirBnB as it seemed to be a perfect fit for my lifestyle and the flexibility in which it offers as both a guest and a host.

For fun, I enjoy pretty much any of the performing arts, particularly theater, music, and improv comedy. I love movies - way too many to starting naming specific titles but I will say the Lord of the Rings and Harry Potter series (books & movies) changed my life. 

I'm a big believer in kindness and consideration. The golden rule: "treat others the way you wish to be treated." I feel the same way about my belongings and those of others. : )

name: Lovely 1 Bedroom Apartment/WIFI/walk to Path/NYC
description: Located in the Journal Square area, this bright and clean 1-bedroom apartment offers easy access to everything you need. The apartment features a queen bed and a queen sleeper sofa, comfortably accommodating up to 4 people. Stay connected with fast WIFI throughout your stay.
neighborhood_overview:
Journal Square is a vibrant and bustling neighborhood, known for its central transportation hub and rich cultural heritage.

At the heart of Journal Square is the Journal Square Transportation Center, a major transportation hub connecting various forms of transit, including buses, trains, and PATH (Port Authority Trans-Hudson) trains. This central location makes it a convenient hub for commuting to New York City and other parts of New Jersey, attracting a diverse range of residents and visitors.
Journal Square is a melting pot of cultures, offering a vibrant tapestry of ethnic diversity. This is reflected in the variety of cuisines, shops, and markets found throughout the neighborhood. From Indian and Middle Eastern eateries to Latin American and Caribbean flavors, there is no shortage of culinary delights to explore. You can also find an array of local shops, markets, and specialty stores that cater to diverse tastes and preferences.

description: Experience style and comfort at this cozy 1-bedroom brownstone in the heart of Downtown Jersey City! Newly renovated and nestled in a safe, quiet neighborhood, you’ll be just two blocks away from fantastic restaurants, a vibrant farmer’s market, and easy street parking. neighborhood_overview: Van Vorst Park is a neighborhood in the Historic Downtown of Jersey City, Hudson County, NJ centered on a park sharing the same name. The neighborhood is located west of Paulus Hook and Marin Boulevard, north of Grand Street, east of the Turnpike Extension, and south of The Village and Christopher Columbus Drive. Much of it is included in the Van Vorst Park Historical District.

neighborhood_overview: Jersey City is in northeastern New Jersey. Its eastern waterfront faces the Hudson River where it meets Upper New York Bay. Liberty State Park has panoramic views of the Manhattan skyline, the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island, the former immigrant gateway. The park’s Liberty Science Center features interactive exhibits, live animals and an IMAX Dome theater. Bars and ethnic eateries line downtown’s Grove Street.

Hi! I’m from Chicago and I live in Jersey City (Journal Square section) now.  I lived in Manhattan for a few years and when I was able to buy something I chose Jersey City. It’s  a very cool place and is a shorter trip to NYC than most of Brooklyn. I'm listing my place while I do some cosmetic work on the space upstairs (no noisy work).  I also travel quite a bit so I thought I would host. I’ve got a magical and freaky bald dog (I failed at my first time fostering. He never left.) so, of course, your pet is welcome. I’m Ukrainian and plan on signing up for the Airbnb refugee hosting program which I’m very excited about. I’m responsible and chill and like making people feel welcome. 
Good luck with your search!

The Heights additionally boasts its own lush green fields in Pershing Field Park, aquatic diversions at the Reservoir, fresh adventures through the Riverview Farmers Market or strolls through the Riverview Arts District. neighborhood_overview:
Perched above Hoboken and offering stunning views of the Manhattan skyline, "The Heights" is a burgeoning neighborhood in Jersey City, NJ, quickly becoming a favorite destination for tourists. And it’s easy to see why! From Riverview-Fisk Park, located between Palisade and Ogden Avenues, you can take in breathtaking views of the Hudson River and the iconic Manhattan skyline. For early risers, a stroll to the park's observation deck at sunrise provides a tranquil experience, as you witness the dawn break over NYC—one of the most peaceful moments that The Heights has to offer.

Jersey City is the most ethnically diverse city in both New Jersey and the United States, a richness reflected in the wide array of ethnic restaurants that grace The Heights. Most dining spots, bars, coffee shops, and parks can be found along Central Avenue, while trendier options are situated on Palisade Avenue. neighborhood_overview: A residential neighborhood with some Victorian and Edwardian homes, The Heights has multicultural restaurants, cafes, and ice cream shops along Central Avenue. Adjacent to a large reservoir, Pershing Field features an indoor skating rink and swimming pool, while Leonard Gordon Park is known for its early-1900s buffalo and bears statues by sculptor Solon Borglum. Washington Park and Riverview Park offer sports courts and a playground. Well connected with public transport to downtown Jersey, Hoboken and New York City.

neighborhood_overview:
Journal Square is a vibrant and bustling neighborhood, known for its central transportation hub and rich cultural heritage.

At the heart of Journal Square is the Journal Square Transportation Center, a major transportation hub connecting various forms of transit, including buses, trains, and PATH (Port Authority Trans-Hudson) trains. This central location makes it a convenient hub for commuting to New York City and other parts of New Jersey, attracting a diverse range of residents and visitors.
Journal Square is a melting pot of cultures, offering a vibrant tapestry of ethnic diversity. This is reflected in the variety of cuisines, shops, and markets found throughout the neighborhood. From Indian and Middle Eastern eateries to Latin American and Caribbean flavors, there is no shortage of culinary delights to explore. name: Modern & Clean 4-Bedroom in Jersey City Heights
description:
Welcome to this brand-new construction 4-bedroom, 2-bathroom unit. We are excited to host you here!

This unit is on an idyllic street in Jersey City Heights, just a 10 min bus, 7 min Uber, or 20 minute walk to the Hoboken PATH train. Easy commute into NYC while having way more space than in Manhattan or Brooklyn.

We personally occupy the unit above, and take pride in keeping our home a nice place to stay.

Monthly bookings only.

Street parking only, car must be moved for street cleaning.
host_about:
Hi, I'm Miz!

I have lived in the NYC area for 8 years, and have been sharing my space (now spaces!) with guests since 2014. I love hosting!

I grew up in Houston, Texas, went to college in Pennsylvania, and spent time living in Italy, Spain, and Australia before moving to NYC. I currently live in Jersey City.

I am a real estate agent and property manager, and in my spare time I enjoy long walks in the neighborhood, wandering around NYC, all the self-care (massages, facials, yoga), and eating out (plus a good cocktail) with friends. 

I'm an avid traveler and have stayed with friends all over the world. I love to get a local experience when I travel, so I'm happy to provide that for my guests. My partner Mario and I host together, so you may hear or see him as well! 

Any and all questions welcome! I want to make sure you have a great time in Jersey City & NYC.

neighborhood_overview: Given Jersey City's proximity and accessibility by rapid transit to Manhattan, Jersey City is sometimes referred to as New York City's Sixth borough. Our house is located between Jersey City's top schools - Saint Peter's University and New Jersey City University. There’s a 24-hour Walgreens and a Dunkin Donuts that's a 1 minute drive/6min walk from the house.
host_about: Hello, my name is Ana & host alongside my husband Josiah. I’m a Senior Program Manager working in Design & Engineering while he works in sports!
